parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.
